subject: Support Request - Amazon #CA56CIDKKVI
description_text:
Dear Simsonn Support,

I am writing to request assistance with my Simsonn Plus X pedals and Haptic
Reactor. They are no longer detected by either the Simsonn Manager
application or my computer, despite being properly connected. I have also
restarted my computer, but the issue persists.

Could you please provide guidance or troubleshooting steps to resolve this
issue?

I bought them on Amazon, here is my invoice attached

Thank you for your time and help.

Sincerely,

*Pierre-Étienne Laporte*
*450-775-9246 | laportepe@gmail.com <laportepe@gmail.com>*
https://www.linkedin.com/in/pierre-etienne-laporte/

conversations.body_text: Hi Pierre-Étienne Laporte,    First, please go to Settings → Update in the software and upgrade to version 2.0.9.  Then follow the steps below to manually update the PlusX firmware:      1.    Press and hold the upgrade button on the PlusX control box;      2.    Plug in the USB while holding the button — the device will enter recovery mode. Then release the button;      3.    Open SIMSONN Manager, go to Settings → Update → Manual Firmware Update,  and select the plusx.sfu file I sent you to complete the update.      Additionally, please download VKB Joy Tester and check whether our device is recognized.  https://www.vkbcontrollers.com/pages/downloads
Hi Pierre-Étienne Laporte,      Make sure to connect the USB cable directly to a USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC, not through a USB hub, as hubs can cause unstable power or data transmission.

Ok I disconnected also some other USB devices. Seems like there was a
conflict. Now it's ok but I have another issue.

On le Mans ultimate the motor of the haptics are not working properly. They
work but when I drive they don't send signal at the right moment. They
don't activate when the ABS is triggering in the game. They seems delayed.

Can you help with that as well?

*Pierre-Étienne Laporte*
*450-775-9246 | laportepe@gmail.com <laportepe@gmail.com>*
https://www.linkedin.com/in/pierre-etienne-laporte/

Hi Pierre-Étienne Laporte,     It’s generally not recommended to use a USB hub, as it may cause unstable connections. Please connect the device directly to a USB 3.0 port on the back of your PC, and keep the USB cable away from power cables to reduce interference.     Please update the software to version 2.0.9 in the settings, and update the PlusX firmware to version 2.0.2. Then test LMU again.  If the issue with LMU still persists, please let me know, and I will arrange for it to be fixed.     Additionally, SIMHUB version 9.9.3 also supports our pedals, so you can use that as well for testing.

Hi Pierre-Étienne Laporte,  If this happens, it indicates that the computer’s grounding is not reliable, possibly because a three-prong plug was not used with a three-prong wall outlet. You can refer to the post below: connect the computer case to the stand, and connect the control box to the metal screws on the pedals. This should resolve the disconnection issue.  https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

Hi Pierre-Étienne Laporte,  If you notice a delayed signal, it is likely caused by adjustments to the mechanical structure. You need to press the offset button to zero the initial pedal signal to 0%, which corresponds to the white progress bar. This ensures the pedal outputs a signal immediately when pressed, rather than only after being pressed partway. This is not a product defect.
